title: Chinese Government donates 100,000 Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $1.8 million in March 2021
description: On March 21, 2021, Benin’s Ministry of Health — represented by the state-owned Société Béninoise pour l'Approvisionnement en Produits de Santé (SOBAPS) — took receipt of 203,000 donated Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses. Only 100,000 doses were donated by the Chinese Government; the rest were purchased by the Government of Benin.  Then, on January 14, 2022, Chinese Government delivered 500,000 donated doses of Sinovac Covid-19 vaccines and syringes to the Government of Benin. Then, on May 10, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered a third batch of Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses as well as medical supplies including syringes, x-ray machines, multi-parameter monitors, electric syringe pumps, medical beds, EKG devices, and resuscitation respirators. A handover certificate was signed by the Charge d'Affaires a.i. of the Chinese Embassy in Benin Yan Yan and the cabinet director of the Beninese Ministry of Health Petas Akogbeto in Cotonou.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the March 2021 donation as $1.8 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates 100,000 Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $1.8 million in March 2021

# Description
On March 21, 2021, Benin’s Ministry of Health — represented by the state-owned Société Béninoise pour l'Approvisionnement en Produits de Santé (SOBAPS) — took receipt of 203,000 donated Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses. Only 100,000 doses were donated by the Chinese Government; the rest were purchased by the Government of Benin.  Then, on January 14, 2022, Chinese Government delivered 500,000 donated doses of Sinovac Covid-19 vaccines and syringes to the Government of Benin. Then, on May 10, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered a third batch of Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses as well as medical supplies including syringes, x-ray machines, multi-parameter monitors, electric syringe pumps, medical beds, EKG devices, and resuscitation respirators. A handover certificate was signed by the Charge d'Affaires a.i. of the Chinese Embassy in Benin Yan Yan and the cabinet director of the Beninese Ministry of Health Petas Akogbeto in Cotonou.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare support through vaccine donations and medical equipment, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses and medical supplies including syringes, x-ray machines, and other healthcare equipment

title: Chinese Government provides anti-epidemic supplies to Benin in March 2021
description: On March 4,2021, the Chinese Government delivered a shipment of anti-epidemic medical aid to the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Benin. The purpose of this donation is to support Benin’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Peng Jingtao, China’s Ambassador to Benin, and Um Patan, the Minister of Health of Benin attended the ceremony. Following the handover of materials,  the two sides signed the "Agreement of Intent between the Health Commission of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Benin on Establishing a Cooperation Mechanism for Counterpart Hospitals." This agreement will allow increased cooperation between hospitals in the two countries concerning COVID-19.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides anti-epidemic supplies to Benin in March 2021

# Description
On March 4,2021, the Chinese Government delivered a shipment of anti-epidemic medical aid to the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Benin. The purpose of this donation is to support Benin’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Peng Jingtao, China’s Ambassador to Benin, and Um Patan, the Minister of Health of Benin attended the ceremony. Following the handover of materials,  the two sides signed the "Agreement of Intent between the Health Commission of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Benin on Establishing a Cooperation Mechanism for Counterpart Hospitals." This agreement will allow increased cooperation between hospitals in the two countries concerning COVID-19.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare and epidemic response without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Anti-epidemic medical aid, COVID-19 response efforts, healthcare cooperation agreement

title: China’s 25th medical team to Benin donates CFA 7.76 million worth of medical supplies in May 2021
description: On May 17, 2021, the 25th Chinese medical team to Benin donated medical supplies to Roxar Central Hospital in the Mono Province of Benin. The shipment consisted of 89 varieties of prescription and over-the-counter medicines, including anti-malarial and hypertension medicines totaling 5.8 million CFA francs; and medical equipment such as masks, medical caps, thermometers, gloves, infusion sets, sterile needles, cotton balls, drainage bags, and more totaling 1.96 million CFA francs.  After the handover of these materials, the medical team hosted a medical clinic and distributed health leaflets on hypertension and common tropical diseases.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China’s 25th medical team to Benin donates CFA 7.76 million worth of medical supplies in May 2021

# Description
On May 17, 2021, the 25th Chinese medical team to Benin donated medical supplies to Roxar Central Hospital in the Mono Province of Benin. The shipment consisted of 89 varieties of prescription and over-the-counter medicines, including anti-malarial and hypertension medicines totaling 5.8 million CFA francs; and medical equipment such as masks, medical caps, thermometers, gloves, infusion sets, sterile needles, cotton balls, drainage bags, and more totaling 1.96 million CFA francs.  After the handover of these materials, the medical team hosted a medical clinic and distributed health leaflets on hypertension and common tropical diseases.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare support and medical supplies donation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of medical supplies and equipment, hosting of medical clinic, health education activities

title: CPFHK provides $840 million loan for Benin Section of Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#58435)
description: On January 23, 2019, the State of Niger and the Republic of Benin signed a bilateral agreement on the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project. Then, on August 5, 2019, the Republic of Benin entrusted the financing, construction, and operation of the Benin section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline to a special purpose vehicle known as the West African Oil Pipeline (Bénin) Company S.A. [WAPCO Bénin or 西非原油管道（贝宁）股份有限公司 in Chinese]. The total cost of the Benin Section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project is $1.05 billion (CFAF 608 billion) and it is being financed according to a debt-to-equity ratio of 80:20. CNPC Finance (HK) Limited (CPFHK) — a subsidiary of the China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) — issued a loan worth an estimated $840 million to WAPCO Bénin for the Benin Section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project. The loan’s estimated interest rate is 8.05%. The other borrowing terms of the loan are unknown.  The purpose of the project is to construct the 675 km Benin section of the 1,980 km Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline, which connects Niger's Agadem Rift Basin to the Port of Sèmè export terminal in the town of Sèmè-Kpodji. The Benin section of the pipeline consists of a 660 km overland subsection and a 15 km underwater subsection. The project scope also includes the construction of two pumping stations — one in Gogounou and the other in Tchatchou. Upon completion, the pipeline is expected to have a capacity of 90,000 barrels per day (bpd). The Government of Benin expects to receive $884.6 million in transit fees during the pipeline’s period of operation and $109 million in tax revenues (VAT and other fees and taxes). The construction of the pipeline is also expected to generate additional traffic to the Port of Cotonou in Benin. The port is expected to process up to 300,000 tons of goods once the pipeline becomes operational.  China Petroleum Planning and Engineering Institute (CPPEI) and the China Petroleum Pipeline Engineering (CPPE) are the contractors responsible for project implementation. The project was originally scheduled to commence on March 15, 2020. However, due to the Covid-19 pandemic, construction did not begin until May 20, 2021. The pipeline was originally scheduled for completion in January 2022. On October 14, 2022, Chinese state-owned broadcaster CGTN referred to the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project as ‘an integral part of China’s Belt and Road Initiative.’ The Niger section of the project had achieved a 30% completion rate as of October 2022 (see Project ID#58435).
staff_comments: 1. The CNPC Finance (HK) Limited loan is not captured in the Chinese Loans to Africa Database developed by SAIS-CARI and maintained by the Global Development Policy Center at Boston University.2. The face value of the CNPC Finance (HK) Limited loan is unknown. However, given that the total cost of the Benin Section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project is $1.05 billion and CNPC Finance (HK) Limited agreed to finance 80% of the project cost with debt, AidData assumes that the face value of the CNPC Finance (HK) Limited loan was roughly equivalent to $840 million. This issue warrants further investigation. Further research is also needed to determine if the CNPC Finance (HK) Limited was supported by any credit enhancements.3. The French project title is Projet Pipeline d'Export Niger-Bénin or Projet de Pipeline d'Exportation Niger-Bénin. The Chinese project title is 西非跨国输油管道项目 or 尼日尔―贝宁油管项目 or 尼日尔-贝宁原油外输管道工程 or 阿加德姆二期油田及外输管道建设项目.4. Africa Energy Intelligence identifies CNPC Finance (HK) Limited  as the lender.5. A feasibility study for the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project — undertaken by the China Petroleum Planning and Engineering Institute (CPPEI) and the China Petroleum Pipeline Engineering (CPPE) — recommended that CPFHK lend at an interest rate between 7.9% and 8.2%. As such, AidData has estimated the loan’s interest rate by taking the midpoint of this range (8.05%).6. The precise financial commitment (loan signing) date is unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes a commitment year of 2020 since this was the first year of project implementation.7. WAPCO Bénin is a subsidiary of the China National Oil and Gas Exploration and Development Co. (CNODC), which is itself a subsidiary of the China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC).8. The January 23, 2019 bilateral agreement between the Government of Niger and the Government of Benin on the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/2jdcbk00xhwynim/Accord%20Bilat%C3%A9ral%20Niger-B%C3%A9nin.pdf?dl=0.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
CPFHK provides $840 million loan for Benin Section of Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#58435)

# Description
On January 23, 2019, the State of Niger and the Republic of Benin signed a bilateral agreement on the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project. Then, on August 5, 2019, the Republic of Benin entrusted the financing, construction, and operation of the Benin section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline to a special purpose vehicle known as the West African Oil Pipeline (Bénin) Company S.A. [WAPCO Bénin or 西非原油管道（贝宁）股份有限公司 in Chinese]. The total cost of the Benin Section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project is $1.05 billion (CFAF 608 billion) and it is being financed according to a debt-to-equity ratio of 80:20. CNPC Finance (HK) Limited (CPFHK) — a subsidiary of the China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) — issued a loan worth an estimated $840 million to WAPCO Bénin for the Benin Section of the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project. The loan’s estimated interest rate is 8.05%. The other borrowing terms of the loan are unknown.  The purpose of the project is to construct the 675 km Benin section of the 1,980 km Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline, which connects Niger's Agadem Rift Basin to the Port of Sèmè export terminal in the town of Sèmè-Kpodji. The Benin section of the pipeline consists of a 660 km overland subsection and a 15 km underwater subsection. The project scope also includes the construction of two pumping stations — one in Gogounou and the other in Tchatchou. Upon completion, the pipeline is expected to have a capacity of 90,000 barrels per day (bpd). The Government of Benin expects to receive $884.6 million in transit fees during the pipeline’s period of operation and $109 million in tax revenues (VAT and other fees and taxes). The construction of the pipeline is also expected to generate additional traffic to the Port of Cotonou in Benin. The port is expected to process up to 300,000 tons of goods once the pipeline becomes operational.  China Petroleum Planning and Engineering Institute (CPPEI) and the China Petroleum Pipeline Engineering (CPPE) are the contractors responsible for project implementation. The project was originally scheduled to commence on March 15, 2020. However, due to the Covid-19 pandemic, construction did not begin until May 20, 2021. The pipeline was originally scheduled for completion in January 2022. On October 14, 2022, Chinese state-owned broadcaster CGTN referred to the Niger-Benin Oil Pipeline Construction Project as ‘an integral part of China’s Belt and Road Initiative.’ The Niger section of the project had achieved a 30% completion rate as of October 2022 (see Project ID#58435).
justification: Primary purpose is construction of oil pipeline infrastructure, increasing fossil fuel dependency
evidence: 675 km oil pipeline connecting Niger's Agadem Rift Basin to Benin's Port of Sèmè, expected capacity of 90,000 barrels per day

title: Chinese Government donates 5 police motorcycles to Bolivia
description: On August 4th, 2021, the Chinese ambassador Huang Yazhong attended the donation ceremony of 5 police motorcycles and accompanying protective clothing at the La Paz South Police Station. Roberto Ríos, Deputy Minister of Civil Security of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Bolivia,  and Jhonny Aguilera, Commander-in-Chief of the National Police attended the event. The motorcycles were a donation to the police forces of Bolivia to help them in their police work, and to "thank them for efforts made to maintain social order and protect the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese personnel and institutions in Bolivia" according to Ambassador Huang.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government donates 5 police motorcycles to Bolivia

# Description
On August 4th, 2021, the Chinese ambassador Huang Yazhong attended the donation ceremony of 5 police motorcycles and accompanying protective clothing at the La Paz South Police Station. Roberto Ríos, Deputy Minister of Civil Security of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Bolivia,  and Jhonny Aguilera, Commander-in-Chief of the National Police attended the event. The motorcycles were a donation to the police forces of Bolivia to help them in their police work, and to "thank them for efforts made to maintain social order and protect the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese personnel and institutions in Bolivia" according to Ambassador Huang.
justification: Project is a donation of police equipment with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 5 police motorcycles and protective clothing for police work, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Government donates medical supplies to the Bolivian government in January 2021
description: On January 26th, 2021, Huang Yazhong, the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia, attended a donation ceremony for medical supplies by the Chinese government to the Bolivian government together with Bolivian Minister of Health Jeyson Auza, Vice Minister of Health Insurance and Management of the Unified Health System, Alejandra Hidalgo Ugarte, and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs in charge of Trade and Integration Affairs Benjamín Blanco.  This batch of medical supplies includes 10 VG70 model respirators to be installed in Intensive Care Units, 4 ShangriLa 510S model respirators used for patient transfer and first aid, and 53 thousand units of rapid antibody tests, which will be used for the early detection of Covid-19.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates medical supplies to the Bolivian government in January 2021

# Description
On January 26th, 2021, Huang Yazhong, the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia, attended a donation ceremony for medical supplies by the Chinese government to the Bolivian government together with Bolivian Minister of Health Jeyson Auza, Vice Minister of Health Insurance and Management of the Unified Health System, Alejandra Hidalgo Ugarte, and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs in charge of Trade and Integration Affairs Benjamín Blanco.  This batch of medical supplies includes 10 VG70 model respirators to be installed in Intensive Care Units, 4 ShangriLa 510S model respirators used for patient transfer and first aid, and 53 thousand units of rapid antibody tests, which will be used for the early detection of Covid-19.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for healthcare purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of respirators and COVID-19 test kits for healthcare purposes

title: China donates 2 million COVID-19 masks and mobile hospital fleet to Bolivia in February 2021
description: On February 18th, 2021, Bolivian President Luis Arce and the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia Huang Yazhong attended a ceremony for a Chinese donation of anti-pandemic aid to Bolivia. This aid included 2 million surgical masks and the KANGFEI-TAG15B(V) mobile hospital fleet. The KANGFEI-TAG15B(V) mobile hospital fleet consisted of 9 vehicles and 6 tents that would travel together and form a hospital with a capacity of 28 beds. The fleet included 1 operations vehicle, 1 first aid vehicle, 1 x-ray diagnostic vehicle, 1 biochemical laboratory vehicle, 1 sterilization vehicle, 1 food supply vehicle, 1 kitchen vehicle, 1 oxygen generator vehicle, and 1 tent support vehicle.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates 2 million COVID-19 masks and mobile hospital fleet to Bolivia in February 2021

# Description
On February 18th, 2021, Bolivian President Luis Arce and the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia Huang Yazhong attended a ceremony for a Chinese donation of anti-pandemic aid to Bolivia. This aid included 2 million surgical masks and the KANGFEI-TAG15B(V) mobile hospital fleet. The KANGFEI-TAG15B(V) mobile hospital fleet consisted of 9 vehicles and 6 tents that would travel together and form a hospital with a capacity of 28 beds. The fleet included 1 operations vehicle, 1 first aid vehicle, 1 x-ray diagnostic vehicle, 1 biochemical laboratory vehicle, 1 sterilization vehicle, 1 food supply vehicle, 1 kitchen vehicle, 1 oxygen generator vehicle, and 1 tent support vehicle.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 2 million surgical masks and mobile hospital fleet for healthcare purposes

title: Chinese Government donates 100,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $1.8 million in March 2021
description: In 2021, the Chinese Government donated approximately 3.6 million doses of Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. The Chinese Government delivered 100,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia on February 24, 2021. Then, on March 30, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 100,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. Then, on August 17, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 300,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. Then, on December 26, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 3.5 million donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the March 2021 donation as $1.8 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
DISASTER PREVENTION AND PREPAREDNESS

# Title
Chinese Government donates 100,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $1.8 million in March 2021

# Description
In 2021, the Chinese Government donated approximately 3.6 million doses of Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. The Chinese Government delivered 100,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia on February 24, 2021. Then, on March 30, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 100,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. Then, on August 17, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 300,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia. Then, on December 26, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 3.5 million donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Bolivia.
justification: Project involves donation of vaccines for public health purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 100,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses, disaster prevention and preparedness sector

title: Chinese Government grants 13 scholarships to Bolivian students in August 2021
description: On August 19th, 2021, Huang Yazhong, the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia, delivered a virtual speech at an award ceremony via Zoom, granting scholarships to 13 Bolivian students. In attendance at the ceremony was Adrián Quelca Tarqui, Bolivian Minister of Education. The students were to pursue undergraduate and graduate degrees at universities in China. The scholarship would cover all necessary costs during the period of study, but would not cover international flights. The students were to begin study in September 2021 and were expected to stay in China between 4-6 years depending on program of study.   The scholarships are channeled through the Plurinational School of Public Management (EGPP), an entity dependent on the Bolivian Ministry of Education which was in charge of organizing the scholarships. The scholarships were awarded under the China-Bolivia Scholarship Cooperation Program, which had recently resumed after a pause during the presidency of Jeanine Áñez.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese title of the scholarship is the 中玻奖学金合作项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government grants 13 scholarships to Bolivian students in August 2021

# Description
On August 19th, 2021, Huang Yazhong, the Chinese ambassador to Bolivia, delivered a virtual speech at an award ceremony via Zoom, granting scholarships to 13 Bolivian students. In attendance at the ceremony was Adrián Quelca Tarqui, Bolivian Minister of Education. The students were to pursue undergraduate and graduate degrees at universities in China. The scholarship would cover all necessary costs during the period of study, but would not cover international flights. The students were to begin study in September 2021 and were expected to stay in China between 4-6 years depending on program of study.   The scholarships are channeled through the Plurinational School of Public Management (EGPP), an entity dependent on the Bolivian Ministry of Education which was in charge of organizing the scholarships. The scholarships were awarded under the China-Bolivia Scholarship Cooperation Program, which had recently resumed after a pause during the presidency of Jeanine Áñez.
justification: Project is focused on education scholarships without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for Bolivian students to study in China, administered through education ministry channels

title: China's sports technical assistance program provides training for Bolivian athletes in December 2021
description: In December 2021, the Bolivian national ski team arrived in Heilongjiang Province to attend a training program at the Yabuli Sports Training Base, China's largest ski resort. The training was provided under China's sport technical assistance program by China Sports International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co., Ltd.  The Bolivian national ski team, composed of eight athletes and coaches, underwent a 60-day full-range technical instruction and training. The training included training with specialist professionals, camps, workshops and provided tickets, lodging, food and training equipment. Two of the athletes went on to participate in the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympic Games.
staff_comments: 1. The Spanish project title is: Programa de Asistencia Técnica Deportiva para Bolivia
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China's sports technical assistance program provides training for Bolivian athletes in December 2021

# Description
In December 2021, the Bolivian national ski team arrived in Heilongjiang Province to attend a training program at the Yabuli Sports Training Base, China's largest ski resort. The training was provided under China's sport technical assistance program by China Sports International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co., Ltd.  The Bolivian national ski team, composed of eight athletes and coaches, underwent a 60-day full-range technical instruction and training. The training included training with specialist professionals, camps, workshops and provided tickets, lodging, food and training equipment. Two of the athletes went on to participate in the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympic Games.
justification: Project focuses on sports training and technical assistance without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Sports technical assistance program, training for Bolivian athletes, no energy-related components
